feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VALDEZ GLACIER DAMMED LAKE RELEASING... Valdez Glacier Dammed Lake on the Valdez Glacier is releasing causing rises on the Valdez Glacier Lake and Stream. The Valdez Glacier Stream is currently at 20.3 ft and has risen over 3 ft since Monday morning. The event is mirroring the release a year ago and is expected to rise an additional 2-3 ft to around 22.5 ft

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 07 at 8:46AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY WEDNESDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence on Wednesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 5:38AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a 20-30% chance of cities such as Reno and Fallon hitting 100 degrees on Friday. Heat

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:19PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Las Animas County through 145 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raton Pass, or 10 miles south of Trinidad, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... In addition melting of mid and high elevation snow will add to runoff

entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN NIOBRARA COUNTY... At 129 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lance Creek, or 16 miles northwest of Lusk, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:22PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Weston County through 200 PM MDT... At 121 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Clareton, or 23 miles west of Newcastle, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lawrence, west central Pennington and northeastern Weston Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 115 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Four Corners, or 15 miles north of Newcastle, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:06PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Niobrara and eastern Converse Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 106 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Manning Ranch, or 25 miles northwest of Lusk, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
